messages.content: What is the purpose of the Pseudocomfy custom nodes package?
The Pseudocomfy custom nodes package is designed to enable multi-regional prompting for architectural rendering, integrated with the Rhino Pseudorandom plugin.
How does the Pseudocomfy package work with ComfyUI?
Pseudocomfy enables multi-regional prompting for architectural rendering within ComfyUI, allowing for more detailed and distributed guidance in scene creation.
What are the benefits of using the Pseudocomfy package?
The Pseudocomfy package provides advanced control over architectural rendering, integrated with ComfyUI for a comprehensive experience.
How does the Pseudocomfy package integrate with the Rhino Pseudorandom plugin?
The Pseudocomfy package integrates with the Rhino Pseudorandom plugin to enhance the functionality of architectural rendering.
What does the input JSON format example provided by Pseudocomfy look like?
The provided input JSON format example includes a description of the scene, rendering style, and negative prompts. It also includes semantic prompts for objects, textures, and depth information.
What are the steps for manual installation instructions for ComfyUI?

Manual installation instructions include installing the `diffusers` library for ComfyUI (Windows Portable Version) and downloading and moving depth ControlNet models to the correct directory. Additionally, specific steps for installing a ControlNet model and IPAdapter Plus custom nodes are detailed.
What are the recommended SD models for the instructions?
For SD-1.5, the recommended model is https://civitai.com/models/104608/ai-angel-mix, and for SD-XL-1.0, the recommended model is https://civitai.com/models/140737/albedobase-xl.
